title: Five merry wives of Lambeth or, the carpenter cornuted. Five wanton wives at Lambeth liv'd I hear which lov'd good wine, good ale, and eke good chear, and something in a corner they would take for which they went abroad to merry make and what they did, if you will but draw near the full conclusion you shall quickly hear. Tune of, I am a jovial batchelor, &c.
publisher: printed for R. Burton at the Horse-shoe in West-Smith-field,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
